subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Race and Religion: Liberation and Oppression
description: A 60-second lesson on Race and Religion: Liberation and Oppression.

hook.text: The Bible justified slavery. The Bible destroyed it. Religion is both the chain and the key in the story of race.

buildup.text: White Christians used scripture to defend slavery. Black Christians used the same book to fight for freedom.

discovery.text: Liberation theology, born in Latin America, argues God sides with the oppressed. Faith that doesn't free isn't real.

twist.text: Sunday morning remains America's most segregated hour. Churches preach unity but practice division along racial lines.

climax.text: Religion's role in race is a mirror: it reflects its followers' values. Liberation requires choosing sides.

punchline.text: The Bible was used for chains and freedom. Religion reflects who reads it.

quiz.question: How has religion related to racial justice?
options: It has been used both to justify oppression and to fight for liberation
